channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Flytip four items just off Scrubbs Cottages lane on footpath, 24th August
item.description:
Park at the end of Whitebeam Ave, walk down a little Scrubbs Cottages: By a tall telegraph pole opposite the directions sign indicating narrow footpath. Items dumped: 1 large lorry(?) size tyre, 2 red traffic cone; 3 child's small tricycle and 4 a considerable length of black wiring. All at the start of footpath. Can all of these items be taken away please.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Whitebeam Avenue, Southborough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytip of white goods, 24th August
item.description:
A white goods, fridge, has been dumped blocking the pavement.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Manor Way, Southborough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned vehicle, 24th August
item.description:
Parked on pavement at junction of Lessness Park & Heron Hill. Front passenger window wide open, back drivers side window open. Called police nothing registered with them CHS28421/24Aug25 Child seat was visible in the vehicle yesterday, but not there today. Thought woman coming round the corner yesterday was owner, but still there today. Blocking dropped kerb so will made access for wheelchairs very difficult.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lessness Park, Lessness Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti across buildings on Rye Lane, 24th August
item.description:
This graffiti has been allowed to stay for many years. It really makes the area look uninviting, intimidating and shows a lack of control by the council. Please cover all of this as is can been seen from quite so distance given its size.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 32, Rye Lane, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Zip wire and general maintenance, 24th August
item.description:
Zip wire was replaced but it doesn't work, all the kids reporting how bad it is. It stops half way and they can't use it. The swing in the middle has been missing for a while and the floor is all damaged. Everything needs some oil as nothing moves freely anymore
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Martens Avenue, Barnehurst, London

item.title: Bushes overhanging the public footpath, 24th August
item.description:
Bushes overhanging the public footpath causing people to have to walk in the road to be able to get past, this is an ongoing issue at this location, every few months we have to report this issue, it’s dangerous for pedestrians especially those with wheelchair or buggies.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woolbrook Road, Crayford, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple Lime bikes abandoned, 24th August
item.description:
On stairs at North and South ends of tunnel In tunnel itself Obstructing pedestrian access and creating hazard With the lifts out and Cutty Sark DLR also out, clearly this tunnel has heavier use from both pedestrians and cyclists. These bikes MUST be removed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Greenwich Foot Tunnel, Isle of Dogs, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Osnaburgh Terrace, Fitzrovia, London

item.title: Overhanging foliage blocking clear access to public footpath, 24th August
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woolbrook Road, Crayford, London
